newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end at new high, P&U in spotlight.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end at new high, P&U in spotlight.

text.p: Swedish shares ended at a new high on Thursday, opening slightly firmer but climbing in afternoon trade after New York opened positively.
The Stockholm general index rose 1.28 percent to 3,048.73 in average turnover of 4.52 billion crowns with all sectors posting gains.
"There is a positive mood in the market," one broker said.
A top performer was U.S./Swedish drugs company Pharmacia & Upjohn after the troubled company announced a restructuring programme. Brokers said this overshadowed confirmation of a weak second quarter.
P&U closed seven crowns higher at 283.5 crowns, dragging the drugs sector index up 1.39 percent.
"It is mainly due to the announcement about the restructuring," one Stockholm-based broker said.
"The fact that there will be no gains in profits in 1997 had already been discounted in the marekt."
Bluechip stocks gained. Drugs heavyweight Astra rose two to 147.5 crowns.
Telecoms major Ericsson rose six to 311.5 crowns. It had won a $106 million contract in Chile and another major GSM contract in China worth $110 million.
Brokers said there was strength in the market, as in other European markets, and it was not just from the U.S..
However they expected the market to be quiet on Friday with the U.S. on holiday for Independence Day and Swedish players starting to leave for summer holidays.
